WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closing this with the assumption that the problem is people don't actually have the full version installed per Kavan's comment with link. If you have this error, reinstall using the Full package
WorkItem.Description:

WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Cannot load the System.Web DLL as it was not found error

Comments.Message:
actually i do.  i have 

Microsoft .NET Framework 4 client profile version 4.0.30319
and 	
Microsoft .NET Framework 4 extended version 4.0.30319

You don't have the current .NET installed for your OS. You can find it by searching .NET on Google



** Closed by Jothay 1/29/2011 11:49 AM

actually i do.  i have 

Microsoft .NET Framework 4 client profile version 4.0.30319
and 	
Microsoft .NET Framework 4 extended version 4.0.30319

Ok looking around on google a bit says that System.Web is only part of the full .NET Framework, but not in client profile. You can get it from http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=9cfb2d51-5ff4-4491-b0e5-b386f32c0992&displaylang=en.

We might want to investigate if it's feasible to reduce dependencies to client profile assemblies only.

So I guess if you really do have the full version, then we need to go one step further and identify why it is failing to locate the dll.

First would be to check if you actually have the dlls. On my computer it is located at C:\Program Files (x86)\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\Framework\.NETFramework\v4.0. You should also find it in the global assembly cache which I believe you can find at C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\assembly\GAC_32 or GAC_64.

If that still looks ok we'll need to check this with asembly binding log viewer (Fuslogvw.exe). It should be located at C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\Windows\v7.0A\Bin\x64 (or without x64 for 32 bit). You can get information on how to use it at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/e74a18c4.aspx. Basically start the log and either view details of existing failure or start Rawr and generate the error. Then post the log details here.
In addition to what Kavan asked for, is this happening in the WPF or Silverlight version? Can you check to see if its happening in both?
No this would almost certainly be limited to WPF based on description.

I'm experiencing the same issue, same errors, with the latest r57608 build, when trying to load from any Battle.net server I try. However I can load characters fine using the web-based Silverlight version.

- I do have .NET framework 4 installed. According to Windows update it's the latest

- I'm using Win 7 64-bit, admin privs
More reports of the same won't help. We need someone with this issue to provide us with the results from Fuslogvw log as explained in an earlier post in order to come closer to a resolution for this.

My apologies. Please ignore my previous comment. Despite my updates telling me that .NET 4 was installed, the folders in the path Kavan listed further down did not exist. I reinstalled it and it's all working fine.
